image.altText: hero

props.synopsis: An ABC NEWS Verify investigation has found organisers linked to the March for Australia protests sharing white supremacy posts on social media and, in one case, pro-Nazi and pro-Hitler memes.

title.children: 'Protect white heritage': Anti-immigration march 'messaging' revealed

props.synopsis: The suspected gunman — 56-year-old Porepunkah man Dezi Freeman — has been on the run since Tuesday after entering alpine bushland on foot, and is believed to be heavily armed.

title.children: No sightings of alleged Porepunkah gunman as manhunt enters day three

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Friends pay tribute to slain police officer
Police cars seen leaving staging area
Pets left alone as residents unable to get home

props.synopsis: Accused Porepunkah gunman Dezi Freeman's commenting history on Instagram shows a strong resistance to police authority, including mentioning dead and incinerated police.

title.children: Accused gunman Dezi Freeman wrote about dead police on Instagram

image.altText: A woman and man hold each other surrounded by a crowd.

props.synopsis: Australian Taxation Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has avoided convictions and a jail sentence, seven years after publicly exposing aggressive debt collection practices at the tax office.

title.children: ATO whistleblower Richard Boyle spared convictions, jail sentence

image.altText: A storm looms over Djuritte (Mount Arapiles) in Western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Spring is shaping up to be warm and wet for large parts of country as warm seas off WA's north-west kick a major climate driver into gear.

title.children: BOM forecasts wet spring as severe storm barrels towards nation's south

image.altText: Bob Katter points his finger wearing a wide brimmed hat and a suit.

props.synopsis: Federal MP Bob Katter was speaking outside the Queenland Parliament with state members of the Katter’s Australia Party about his intention to attend a March For Australia event this weekend.

title.children: 'I've punched blokes in the mouth for saying that': Bob Katter erupts at journalist

image.altText: The picture of a girl wearing a red school blazer and glasses

props.synopsis: Year 7 student Milla Killeen was killed and more than 20 children taken to hospital when the Christian College Geelong bus rolled near Geelong on Wednesday morning.

title.children: School bus rollover victim identified as talented 12yo basketballer

image.altText: the tail of a Qantas Boeing 767

props.synopsis: Qantas reports a 28 per cent rise in net profit to $1.6 billion in the last financial year, as strong travel demand boosts earnings across domestic and international.

title.children: Qantas profit leaps 28 per cent to $1.6 billion

image.altText: Marles and Vance in black suit, red tie, Hegseth in blue suit, tie, all smiling, stand in front of Australia, US flags, table.

props.synopsis: The Greens defence spokesperson says the Pentagon's insistence that the counterparts met by "happenstance" signals the Trump administration's contempt for Australia.

title.children: Pentagon says Marles meeting with Hegseth a 'happenstance encounter'

image.altText: Jeff Fox, smiling, holds up medals in a green and gold Australia jacket.

props.synopsis: Australia's three-time Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox says she has been left with some "gnarly scars" and some added toughness after undergoing successful surgery.

title.children: Jess Fox sidelined after 'whirlwind' surgery to remove kidney tumour

image.altText: Usman wearing a yellow shirt speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese meets with Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza following an earlier meeting being cancelled. Follow live.

title.children: Usman Khawaja urges Australia to 'be a leader' on Gaza after meeting with PM

image.altText: A man and woman, holding hands and looking serious, walking outside a courtroom, on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's defence barrister David Edwardson KC has finished his closing address in the Netflix star's trial in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with the judge now giving jurors their final instructions.

title.children: Matt Wright's defence says injured pilot 'failed in his duty' before crash – as it happened

image.altText: Stocks displayed on a screen at the ASX

props.synopsis: Qantas shares have risen strongly following a better-than-expected $1.6 billion net profit, but the ASX overall is fairly flat. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX seesaws as Qantas shares soar to record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX still flat overall, despite some big moves up and down
Private sector business spending lifts: ABS
Sequoia tells investors in First Guardian and Shield schemes, it will help with 'possible remedies'

image.altText: Two men standing side by side in bulletproof vests with a white car behind them.

props.synopsis: Russia's desire to take Donbas from Ukraine is so strong they are using troops on motorbikes as cannon fodder, and as they do this, Ukrainians are in a race against time to save civilians.

title.children: 'Suicide bikes': Russia's kamikaze tactics to take Donbas

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for expelling the Iranian ambassador and listing the IRGC as a terrorist organisation, but no end to the political brawl over antisemitic attacks in Australia.

title.children: The government takes swift action on Iran but the Coalition maintains the rage

image.altText: Six residents from Mount Atkinson stand with development plan leaflets

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's booming outer west say developers have failed to deliver on their initial sales pitches — prompting a push for tighter restrictions on the way new communities are advertised.

title.children: They bought into a new community — but 'promises' remain undelivered

image.altText: Man stands in kitchen holding coffee cup

props.synopsis: Property owners at a Darwin apartment complex have each had to find at least $50,000 to pay a body corporate special levy, leaving many in financial difficulty.

title.children: 'Cost me a fortune': NT man sells apartment for loss after strata nightmare

image.altText: solar panels.

props.synopsis: The Powering Skills Organisation warns the current energy workforce of 300,000 energy, gas and renewables sector workers will not be sufficient to meet demand and further investment in training will be needed.

title.children: Net zero transition at risk of stalling amid shortfall of 42,000 workers

image.altText: An older Aboriginal man wearing a red headband.

props.synopsis: The family of Kumanjayi White, a young Warlpiri man who died in May after plain-clothes police restrained him in an Alice Springs supermarket, sues the NT government for damages.

title.children: 'Messed with the wrong family': Relatives sue over police restraint death

image.altText: Leigh Read sitting on his desk

props.synopsis: Moving an individual's super out of funds that invest in fossil fuels is a popular climate action in Australia, but what is less common is entire organisations making the shift.

title.children: Employers switching super funds to send climate message

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses and a light blue top speaks to journalists.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds has won her defamation case against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, but the emotional and financial toll of the three-year legal battle has been immense for both women.

title.children: Reynolds vindicated in defamation battle against Higgins, but at what cost?

image.altText: A Palestinian carries a box of food from the World Food Program with a group of other men.

props.synopsis: Israel's military has begun the next phase of the war — Operation Gideon's Chariots II. Some fear it could be even more deadly and devastating.

title.children: 'A city of ruins': Why the next moves in Gaza could be the most dangerous

image.altText: A woman in black clothing stands in front of a red dirt artwork.

props.synopsis: Former track cyclist and downhill skier Sophie Cape says she struggled after losing her Olympic dreams to injury but found catharsis in art school.

title.children: Former elite athlete takes home $100,000 landscape art prize

image.altText: A star logo and the words "'THE STAR" on the side of a high-rise building.

props.synopsis: It's the last roll of the dice for what was once one of the country's biggest casino groups, as yet another dispute with exasperated bankers delays a potentially lifesaving deal.

title.children: Star under another cloud as bankers lose patience

image.altText: Priscilla Hon winds up to serve at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Australian qualifier Priscilla Hon stuns 17th seed Liudmila Samsonova to reach the third round of a grand slam for the first time.

title.children: Aussie qualifier Priscilla Hon reaches US Open third round with stunning upset

image.altText: Jelena Ostapenko points and shouts during an argument with Taylor Townsend.

props.synopsis: American Taylor Townsend clashes with 25th seed Jeļena Ostapenko at the US Open, with Ostapenko telling her she has "no class and no education" after Townsend's upset win.

title.children: Ostapenko tells US Open opponent she has 'no class and no education'

image.altText: Mitch Brown speaking to the Daily Aus.

props.synopsis: Openly gay male athletes are rare in mainstream Australian sport, but some have built up the courage to share their story.

title.children: Mitch Brown a rare example of a queer player in men's sport

image.altText: woman in underwear looking into mirror

props.synopsis: Despite up to 15 per cent of people in Australia having genital herpes, many of us find it extremely hard to talk about. But you can still have a fulfilling sex life with herpes.

title.children: Many people have herpes, so why can't we talk about it?

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes sings alongside a guitarist and pianist in a lavish family living room.

props.synopsis: From fascinating films on underrated cult bands to fresh perspectives on The Beatles and Cold Chisel, here's the latest and greatest music cinema.

title.children: From slacker rock to cult art-punk, these music docos are must-sees

image.altText: Ruben Amorim on his haunches pitchside

props.synopsis: Embattled Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim says his players "spoke for me really loud" after being turned into a viral internet joke during his side's embarrassing loss to a fourth-tier side in the English League Cup.

title.children: Man United boss slams players as horror loss sees him turned into meme

image.altText: Jarrod Witts celebrates the final goal of the match for the Gold Coast Suns

props.synopsis: From Gary Ablett to Noah Anderson and Matt Rowell, from Guy McKenna to Damien Hardwick, it's been a long, long road to September football for the Gold Coast Suns. Andrew McGarry looks back on the journey for the 18th and last AFL team to clinch finals.

title.children: From Ablett to Anderson — the Suns' long road to the AFL finals

image.altText: USA women's rugby player Ilona Maher is wearing a black cutout dress and flexes her muscles, smiling, while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: Sponsors have not always flocked to women's sport, or targeted female fans, but they are now realising the potential of reaching women, and embracing femininity in sport.

title.children: Why big name beauty brands are cashing in on women in sport
